required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Tolerability of a Foaming Facial Cleanser and Moisturizer SPF 30 in a Pediatric Population (7-11) With Acne Prone Skin.
clinical_study.official_title: Tolerability of a Foaming Facial Cleanser and Moisturizer SPF 30 in a Pediatric Population (7-11) With Acne Prone Skin.

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine the tolerability of Cetaphil® DermaControl™ Foam Wash and Moisturizer SPF 30 in pediatric subjects (7-11) with acne prone skin.

detailed_description.textblock: This was a open-label, single center study conducted in the United States that evaluated the tolerability of Cetaphil® DermaControl™ skin care products used at least once daily for 22 days in male and female subjects age 7 to 11 with acne prone skin. There were 4 visits during the course of the study: screening (within 7 days of visit 1), visit 1(baseline /day1), visit 2 (day 8), and visit 3 (day 22/exit). Tolerability assessments were performed by a board certified dermatologist at all visits. Subjects completed the baseline skin care regimen questionnaire at visit 1. Hydration assessments were competed at visits 1, 2, and 3. A subject satisfaction questionnaire was completed at visit 3. Adverse event assessments were conducted for all subjects at every clinic visit after informed consent/assent was signed.

primary_outcome.measure: Cutaneous Tolerability Based on Visual Inspection - Erythema
primary_outcome.description: Cutaneous tolerability based on visual inspection (investigator reported severity scale) was assessed at visit 1 (day 1), visit 2 (day 8), and visit 3 (day 22). Erythema: 0 = none, no observable redness; 1 = very mild, slight redness, spotty or diffuse; 2 = mild, moderate redness; 3 = moderate, intense; 4 = severe, fiery red with edema.

primary_outcome.measure: Cutaneous Tolerability Based on Visual Inspection - Edema
primary_outcome.description: Cutaneous tolerability based on visual inspection (investigator reported severity scale) was assessed at visit 1 (day 1), visit 2 (day 8), and visit 3 (day 22). Edema: 0 = none; 1 = mild; 2 = moderate; 3 = intense.

primary_outcome.measure: Cutaneous Tolerability Based on Visual Inspection - Dryness
primary_outcome.description: Cutaneous tolerability based on visual inspection (investigator reported severity scale) was assessed at visit 1 (day 1), visit 2 (day 8), and visit 3 (day 22). Dryness: 0 = no observable scaling; 1 = fine flakes/scaling; 2 = moderate flakes/scaling; 3 = larger flakes/severe scaling.

primary_outcome.measure: Cutaneous Tolerability Based on Visual Inspection - Roughness
primary_outcome.description: Cutaneous tolerability based on visual inspection (investigator reported severity scale) was assessed at visit 1 (day 1), visit 2 (day 8), and visit 3 (day 22). Roughness: 1 - no roughness, skin is fine, silky smooth, 2 - firm (not too rough, not too smooth), 3 - coarse, rough skin, 4 - leathery, flaky skin.

secondary_outcome.measure: Cutaneous Tolerability Based on Subject and Parent/Legally Authorized Representative Interview - Itching
secondary_outcome.description: Cutaneous tolerability based on visual inspection (investigator reported severity scale) was assessed at visit 1 (day 1), visit 2 (day 8), and visit 3 (day 22). Itching: 0 = none, no itching; 1 = mild, slight itching, not really bothersome; 2 = moderate, definite itching that is somewhat bothersome; 3 = severe, intense itching that may interrupt daily activities and/or sleep

secondary_outcome.measure: Cutaneous Tolerability Based on Subject and Parent/Legally Authorized Representative Interview - Burning
secondary_outcome.description: Cutaneous tolerability based on visual inspection (investigator reported severity scale) was assessed at visit 1 (day 1), visit 2 (day 8), and visit 3 (day 22). Burning: 0 = none, no burning; 1 = mild, slight burning sensation, not really bothersome; 2 = moderate, definite warm, burning sensation that is somewhat bothersome; 3 = severe, hot burning sensation that causes definite discomfort and may interrupt daily activities and/or sleep

secondary_outcome.measure: Cutaneous Tolerability Based on Subject and Parent/Legally Authorized Representative Interview - Stinging
secondary_outcome.description: Cutaneous tolerability based on visual inspection (investigator reported severity scale) was assessed at visit 1 (day 1), visit 2 (day 8), and visit 3 (day 22). Stinging: 0 = none, no stinging; 1 = mild, slight stinging sensation, not really bothersome; 2 = moderate, definite stinging sensation that is somewhat bothersome; 3 = severe, stinging sensation that causes definite discomfort and may interrupt daily activities and/or sleep

secondary_outcome.measure: Cutaneous Tolerability Based on Subject and Parent/Legally Authorized Representative Interview - Tightness
secondary_outcome.description: Cutaneous tolerability based on visual inspection (investigator reported severity scale) was assessed at visit 1 (day 1), visit 2 (day 8), and visit 3 (day 22). Tightness: 0 = none, no tightness; 1 = mild, slight tightness, not really bothersome; 2 = moderate, definite tightness sensation that is somewhat bothersome; 3 = severe, tightness sensation that causes definite discomfort and may interrupt daily activities and/or sleep

Barrier function was assessed by measuring transepidermal water loss (TEWL) at visit 1 (day 1), visit 2 (day 8), and visit 3 (day 22). TEWL measures water loss through the epidermis (for example, by evaporation). Measuring TEWL is a well-established way to assess the skin's water-barrier function. High TEWL values indicate impaired skin barrier function; low values indicate normal barrier function.

Hydration was assessed using corneometry at visit 1 (day 1), visit 2 (day 8), and visit 3 (day 22). Corneometry measures the hydration status of the skin. An increase in corneometry values indicates an increase in the hydration status of the skin, and vice versa. The test is procedure specific, so results are reported in "arbitrary units."

All subjects used Cetaphil® DermaControl™ Oil Control Foam Wash and Cetaphil® DermaControl™ Oil Control Moisturizer SPF 30 at least once daily for 22 days. Patient satisfaction questions were asked for the face wash at study end (day 22).

All subjects used Cetaphil® DermaControl™ Oil Control Foam Wash and Cetaphil® DermaControl™ Oil Control Moisturizer SPF 30 at least once daily for 22 days. Patient satisfaction questions were asked for the moisturizer at study end (day 22).

arm_group.description: All subjects used Cetaphil® DermaControl™ Oil Control Foam Wash and Cetaphil® DermaControl™ Oil Control Moisturizer SPF 30 at least once daily for 22 days.

intervention.description: Cetaphil® DermaControl™ Foam Wash and Moisturizer SPF 30

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male and female subjects 7-11 years of age
- Subjects with acne-prone skin [Global severity of acne (GSA) Score of 1 (almost clear) or 2 (mild) and any oiliness evaluation score or GSA Score of 0 (none) with an oiliness evaluation score greater than or equal to 1 (mild)]
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects with any visible skin condition or facial hair that could interfere with the evaluations
- Subjects taking other medications, supplements, or non-prescription treatments that, in the opinion of the principal investigator/board certified dermatologist, could interfere with the test results including any regimen of steroidal/non steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs or antihistamines
- Subjects currently under the treatment for asthma or diabetes (insulin-dependent only)
- Subjects with abnormal pigmented vascular skin lesions, abnormal skin pigmentation, or body art (tattoos, permanent or temporary) on the face, which could interfere with subsequent evaluations of dermal responsiveness

group.title: Cetaphil® DermaControl™ Regimen.
group.description: All subjects used Cetaphil® DermaControl™ Oil Control Foam Wash and Cetaphil® DermaControl™ Oil Control Moisturizer SPF 30 at least once daily for 22 days. Facial Cleanser and Moisturizer SPF 30: Cetaphil® DermaControl™ Foam Wash and Moisturizer SPF 30

group.title: Cetaphil® DermaControl™ Regimen.
group.description: All subjects used Cetaphil® DermaControl™ Oil Control Foam Wash and Cetaphil® DermaControl™ Oil Control Moisturizer SPF 30 at least once daily for 22 days. Facial Cleanser and Moisturizer SPF 30: Cetaphil® DermaControl™ Foam Wash and Moisturizer SPF 30

class.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

measure.title: Fitzpatrick Skin Type
measure.description: Fitzpatrick Skin Type Classification I Always burns; never tans II Burns easily; tans minimally III Burns moderately; tans gradually to light brown IV Burns minimally; tans well to moderate brown V Rarely burns; tans profusely to dark brown VI Never burns; tans profusely to black

outcome.title: Cutaneous Tolerability Based on Visual Inspection - Erythema
outcome.description: Cutaneous tolerability based on visual inspection (investigator reported severity scale) was assessed at visit 1 (day 1), visit 2 (day 8), and visit 3 (day 22). Erythema: 0 = none, no observable redness; 1 = very mild, slight redness, spotty or diffuse; 2 = mild, moderate redness; 3 = moderate, intense; 4 = severe, fiery red with edema.

group.title: Baseline
group.description: All subjects used Cetaphil® DermaControl™ Oil Control Foam Wash and Cetaphil® DermaControl™ Oil Control Moisturizer SPF 30 at least once daily for 22 days and were assessed for tolerability at baseline, week 1, and week 3. This arm shows the results from baseline.

group.title: Week 1
group.description: All subjects used Cetaphil® DermaControl™ Oil Control Foam Wash and Cetaphil® DermaControl™ Oil Control Moisturizer SPF 30 at least once daily for 22 days and were assessed for tolerability at baseline, week 1, and week 3. This arm shows the results from week 1.

group.title: Week 3
group.description: All subjects used Cetaphil® DermaControl™ Oil Control Foam Wash and Cetaphil® DermaControl™ Oil Control Moisturizer SPF 30 at least once daily for 22 days and were assessed for tolerability at baseline, week 1, and week 3. This arm shows the results from week 3.

group.title: Worst Post Baseline
group.description: All subjects used Cetaphil® DermaControl™ Oil Control Foam Wash and Cetaphil® DermaControl™ Oil Control Moisturizer SPF 30 at least once daily for 22 days and were assessed for tolerability at baseline, week 1, and week 3. This arm shows the worst post baseline results for all time ponts collected.

outcome.title: Barrier Function (TEWL)
outcome.description: Barrier function was assessed by measuring transepidermal water loss (TEWL) at visit 1 (day 1), visit 2 (day 8), and visit 3 (day 22). TEWL measures water loss through the epidermis (for example, by evaporation). Measuring TEWL is a well-established way to assess the skin’s water-barrier function. High TEWL values indicate impaired skin barrier function; low values indicate normal barrier function.

outcome.title: Subject Satisfaction Questionnaire - Face Wash
outcome.description: All subjects used Cetaphil® DermaControl™ Oil Control Foam Wash and Cetaphil® DermaControl™ Oil Control Moisturizer SPF 30 at least once daily for 22 days. Patient satisfaction questions were asked for the face wash at study end (day 22).

group.title: I Liked Using the Face Wash
group.description: All subjects used Cetaphil® DermaControl™ Oil Control Foam Wash and Cetaphil® DermaControl™ Oil Control Moisturizer SPF 30 at least once daily for 22 days. Patient satisfaction questions were asked for the face wash at study end (day 22).

group.title: The Face Wash Was Easy to Use
group.description: All subjects used Cetaphil® DermaControl™ Oil Control Foam Wash and Cetaphil® DermaControl™ Oil Control Moisturizer SPF 30 at least once daily for 22 days. Patient satisfaction questions were asked for the face wash at study end (day 22).

group.title: The Face Wash Made my Skin Feel Clean
group.description: All subjects used Cetaphil® DermaControl™ Oil Control Foam Wash and Cetaphil® DermaControl™ Oil Control Moisturizer SPF 30 at least once daily for 22 days. Patient satisfaction questions were asked for the face wash at study end (day 22).

group.title: The Face Wash Rinsed Easily Off my Skin
group.description: All subjects used Cetaphil® DermaControl™ Oil Control Foam Wash and Cetaphil® DermaControl™ Oil Control Moisturizer SPF 30 at least once daily for 22 days. Patient satisfaction questions were asked for the face wash at study end (day 22).

group.title: I Would Keep Using the Face Wash
group.description: All subjects used Cetaphil® DermaControl™ Oil Control Foam Wash and Cetaphil® DermaControl™ Oil Control Moisturizer SPF 30 at least once daily for 22 days. Patient satisfaction questions were asked for the face wash at study end (day 22).

group.title: I Liked the Face Wash Better Than What I Was Using Before
group.description: All subjects used Cetaphil® DermaControl™ Oil Control Foam Wash and Cetaphil® DermaControl™ Oil Control Moisturizer SPF 30 at least once daily for 22 days. Patient satisfaction questions were asked for the face wash at study end (day 22). Subjects were only required to respond to this question if they had used a face wash previously.

reported_events.time_frame: There were 3 visits during the course of the study: visit 1(baseline/day1), visit 2 (day 8), and visit 3 (day 22/exit). Adverse event assessments were conducted for all subjects at every clinic visit after informed consent/assent was signed.

group.title: Cetaphil® DermaControl™ Regimen.
group.description: All subjects used Cetaphil® DermaControl™ Oil Control Foam Wash and Cetaphil® DermaControl™ Oil Control Moisturizer SPF 30 at least once daily for 22 days. Facial Cleanser and Moisturizer SPF 30: Cetaphil® DermaControl™ Foam Wash and Moisturizer SPF 30

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
